SENT.plain: The etiology and treatment of BehÃ§et's diseases are still undecided
There are three principal etiological hypotheses: viral, autoimmune and defective fibrinolytic activity
Accordingly, antiviral, immunosuppressive and fibrinolytic enhancing agents have been tried
Corticosteroids, however, still consitute conventional therapy

Follow-up of cases has so far revealed that none of the above therapeutic measures fundamentally alters the course of the disease, and serious complications may occur and progress during their administration
